title: Differentiated Instruction (DI) Design and Implementation Workshop for Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative learning environment using digital devices for high school students preparing for careers in medical/legal/technical fields.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze students' readiness, interest, and profiles through diagnostic assessments.
Learners can design Differentiated Instruction (DI) strategies across three dimensions—content, process, and product—in math classes.
Learners can propose improvements for DI lessons by reflecting on formative assessment results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
